com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Interface IPSDbComponent

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, IPSCmsComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSAction, PSActionParameters, PSActionProperties, PSActionVisibilityContexts, PSChildActions, PSClientItem, PSCmsProperty, PSComponentSummaries, PSComponentSummary, PSContentType, PSContentTypeSet, PSContentTypeVariant, PSContentTypeVariantSet, PSCoreItem, PSDbComponent, PSDbComponentCollection, PSDbComponentList, PSDbComponentSet, PSDFColumns, PSDFProperties, PSDisplayFormat, PSFolder, PSFolderAcl, PSFolderProperty, PSItemChild, PSItemChildEntry, PSItemComponent, PSItemField, PSItemFieldMeta, PSItemRelatedItem, PSMultiValuedProperty, PSObjectAcl, PSSearch, PSServerItem, PSSFields, PSSlotType, PSSlotTypeContentTypeVariant, PSSlotTypeContentTypeVariantSet, PSSlotTypeSet, PSSProperties, PSVariantSlotType, PSVariantSlotTypeSet, com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSVersionableDbComponent
public interface IPSDbComponent
extends IPSCmsComponent

The CMS objectstore represents CMS concepts such as folders and slots as Java objects. These objects know they are persisted in a database and they can generate an Xml representation that can be passed to a Rhythmyx resource to perform the updates (toDbXml). Every such object must implement this interface.

Although the objects know about the database, they don't know how to reach the database. This is where the PSProcessorProxy and PSCmsProcessor objects come in. They are responsible for making sure the data gets to the server and is passed to the appropriate resource. See that interface for more details.

The purpose of this design is to allow these objects to be used locally on the server and remotely on clients (e.g. web service or workbench). Therefore, any object implementing this interface cannot make any requests to the server. If it must have a server dependency, it should be placed in the server sub-package.

Every derived class must implment a ctor that takes an element so it can be constructed from an element that it generated via its toXml method.

The clone, hashCode and equals methods treat the key and state specially. It is believed that this behavior will be the most commonly desired. Additional methods (xxxFull) have been added that consider the key values and state if that should be required for special circumstances.

Following is a description of how these classes are expected to be used in various cases:

Case Procedure
New instance
  1. Create the object using the new operator. The state will be DBSTATE_NEW and the key will be unassigned and not persisted.
  2. When finished changing it, pass it to the processor's save method.
  3. After the processor has finished, the key will be assigned and persisted and the state will be DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED.
Modify existing
  1. Create the object using the new operator.
  2. Call the processor's load method and pass the returned element to the fromXml method. The key will be assigned and persisted and the state will be DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED.
  3. When finished changing it (after the first change, the state changes to DBSTATE_MODIFIED), pass it to the processor's save method.
  4. After the processor has finished, the state will be DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED.
Delete
  1. If you have a persisted object, call the processor's delete method. Upon return, the key will be unassigned and the state will be DBSTATE_MARKEDFORDELETE, (which will be treated as DBSTATE_NEW if saved again).
  2. If your object has not been persisted, just stop using it, no need to call the processor (if you do, it is a noop.

All 'top-level' components (those that are not used only as a child component) must implement a method that returns the key for the object that conforms to the following prototype:

public static PSKey createKey(String value)

If a value is supplied, an assigned key is created, otherwise, just a key definition is returned.

Field Detail

DBSTATE_NEW

static final int DBSTATE_NEW
A component can be in 1 of 4 states,
  1. This component represents an object that doesn't exist in the database.
  2. This component exactly represents an object as it exists in the database.
  3. This component represents an object in the db but has been changed in some way.
  4. The db object represented by this component no longer exists in the database. This is equivalent to being in the new state.
This value indicates that this object has never been saved to the db.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DBSTATE_MODIFIED

static final int DBSTATE_MODIFIED
See DBSTATE_NEW for a full description. This value indicates that this object started out representing a db object, but has been modified. When it is saved, the db object will be modified to match this component.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED

static final int DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED
See DBSTATE_NEW for a full description. This value indicates that this object started out representing a db object and still does. Performing a save on such a component is a no-op.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DBSTATE_MARKEDFORDELETE

static final int DBSTATE_MARKEDFORDELETE
See DBSTATE_NEW for a full description. This value indicates that this object started out representing a db object, but it is desired to delete it. If it is saved, the processor will permanently remove the component from the database. This is equivalent to passing the component's key to the processor's delete method.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATE_LABELS

static final String[] STATE_LABELS
Labels for each of the DBSTATE_xxx numeric values. The label for the id is stored at the index of the value, e.g. the label for DBSTATE_NEW is STATE_LABELS[DBSTATE_NEW].

Method Detail

getComponentType

String getComponentType()
Every component has a unique type name. Be default this should be the base class name.

Returns:
The type of this component, never null or empty.

getLocator

PSKey getLocator()
Gets the key that uniquely identifies this instance. Return of a key does not mean that this instance has been persisted. To make that determination, call PSKey.isPersisted().

Returns:
A key in 1 of 3 states, just the definition (this is what you would get if you instantiated a new instance), assigned but not persisted, or persisted. The returned key is a clone, so changes to it will not affect this object.

isPersisted

boolean isPersisted()
Whether or not this component is persisted to the database. In most cases checking if the components key is persisted is sufficent. However, in certain cases, collection components, which define their persistence in terms of their contained children, need to provide their own implementation.

Returns:
true if this component is persisted to a db, otherwise false

isAssigned

boolean isAssigned()
Whether or not this component's key is assigned values.

Returns:
true if this component contains a locator that has assigned values, otherwise false

setLocator

void setLocator(PSKey locator)
Sets the key that uniquely identifies this instance. Typically, this is only used by the system, as setting the wrong key could produce unexpected results. Setting a key may cause the state of this object to change to maintain consistency.

The following table shows all possible combinations between the assigned, persisted and state variables of the key and this component, indicating which are allowed and not. The 4 possibilities w/ assigned false and persisted true are left out because the key doesn't allow such a condition.

The various methods that affect these 3 properties maintain the contract as defined in the following table.

isAssigned isPersisted State Allowed
true or false false new yes
true or false false modified no
true or false false unmodified no
true or false false deleted yes
true true new no
true true modified yes
true true unmodified yes
true true deleted no

Parameters:
locator - An id appropriate for this object within the system. Never null. The definition of the supplied key must match the definition of the current key or an exception is thrown. A clone of the supplied key is stored locally, so subsequent changes to locator will not affect this object.

assignKey

void assignKey(com.percussion.cms.objectstore.IPSKeyGenerator gen,
               PSKey parentKey)
               throws PSCmsException
If the key for this component has not been assigned, then the supplied generator is used to assign the key. This can be useful if you are creating linked objects.

Parameters:
gen - May be null if the key for this component is assigned from values in the object.
parentKey - The key of the parent of this object. If this object doesn't have a parent, it should be null. If one is supplied, it must be assigned.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If any errors occur trying to allocate the ids.

toDbXml

void toDbXml(Document doc,
             Element root,
             com.percussion.cms.objectstore.IPSKeyGenerator keyGen,
             PSKey parent)
             throws PSCmsException
Creates an xml fragment properly formatted for use by the processor assigned to this component type which contains information about what has changed in this component since the last time it was persisted. After the database is successfully updated, the handler should call this object's setPersisted() method.

If the state of this object is DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED, null is returned.

Parameters:
doc - This document will be used to create the elements in the result xml fragment. Never null.
root - The generated element will be appended to this node. Never null. If the component doesn't need updating, it won't be appended.
keyGen - This object is used to create new keys when a component has a key that hasn't been assigned yet. Never null.
parent - This param is used for managing foreign key relationships. If the component is a child and this is not supplied, an exception will be thrown.
Throws:
PSCmsException - If any of the components of the specified type have unassigned keys.

getDescription

String getDescription()
Certain components may have associated descriptions.

Returns:
The text of the description, or the empty string if there is none. Never null

setPersisted

void setPersisted()
                  throws PSCmsException
This method is called by the system after a component is successfully modified, whether saving or removing. If the state was new or modified, it must be set to unmodified. If it was deleted, it must be set to new.

Must set the key to persisted or clear the key respectively. If setting the key to persisted, if the key is not assigned, an exception will be thrown. The key must be assigned before the toDbXml method is called.

Generally, only called by system code.

Throws:
PSCmsException - If this instance's key does not have an assigned value.

markForDeletion

void markForDeletion()
If it is desired to remove a component from the database, call this method, then save the component. This is equivalent to calling the processor's delete method with this object's key.

If the object has not been persisted yet, this is a no-op.

fromXml

void fromXml(Element src)
             throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
See interface for complete details. This doc describes additional behaviors. This method makes this object a duplicate of the object represented in serialized form in the xml. More formally, if you have 2 different components, A and B, and you call A.fromXml(B.toXml()). After this operation completes, A.equalsFull(B) will return true.

Specified by:
fromXml in interface IPSCmsComponent
Parameters:
src - The node to extract the data for this instance. Never null. See toXml for the required format of the supplied element.
Throws:
com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException - If the name of the supplied element is incorrect or any of its attributes or children are required but missing or incorrect.

getState

int getState()
Every component maintains a state indicating whether this instance of the object has changed since it was instantiated from its database representation. This state is always one of the DBSTATE_xxx values. Typically, end users of the components do not need to concern themselves with this value, it is managed by the implementation.

Implementing classes are responsible for changing the state as the object is modified (e.g., after re-serializing an object by passing the element returned from the load method of the processor to the fromXml method of this class, the state will be DBSTATE_UNMODIFIED. As soon as an attribute is changed, the setDirty method should be called.)

Returns:
One of the DBSTATE_xxx values.

setState

void setState(int newState)
See getState() for a description. In general, this method should not be called by client code.

Sets the state to the one supplied, if it is allowed according to the doc for setLocator, otherwise an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
newState - One of the DBSTATE_xxx values.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - If setting the state of this object to the supplied one would result in an illegal combination between the state and key.

clone

Object clone()
See the IPSCmsComponent.clone() for complete details. This interface differs as follows: the clone behaves slightly differently for data components. It is still a deep copy, but the clone may differ from the object it was cloned from by the state and key. The values of the key in the clone will be cleared and the state will be set to DBSTATE_NEW. Given an object A, it is guaranteed that A.equals( A.clone()) will return true.

Specified by:
clone in interface IPSCmsComponent
Returns:
a deep-copy clone of this instance, never null.

equals

boolean equals(Object obj)
See the interface for complete details. This interface differs as follows: the key values and current state (DBSTATE_xxx) are not considered in the comparison.

Specified by:
equals in interface IPSCmsComponent
Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
obj - the reference object with which to compare. May be null;
Returns:
true if this object is logically equivalent to the supplied obj; false otherwise. If null or not an instance of this class, false is returned.

hashCode

int hashCode()
See the interface for complete details. This interface differs as follows: the key values and current state (DBSTATE_xxx) are not considered in the calculation. This is to be consistent w/ the equals method.

Specified by:
hashCode in interface IPSCmsComponent
Overrides:
hashCode in class Object
Returns:
A hash code value for this object that will work correctly for maps.

cloneFull

Object cloneFull()
Just like clone(), except it considers the key values and state.

equalsFull

boolean equalsFull(Object obj)
Just like equals(Object), except it considers the key values and state.

hashCodeFull

int hashCodeFull()
Just like hashCode(), except it considers the key values and state.
